title: Groupon : TTM gross profit per average active customer 2017 to 2019
yAxis: TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars
summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Quarter, and TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars in each Quarter on the y axis.
The TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars is highest at Quarter Q1 '19 and lowest at Quarter Q3 '17.
The difference of TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars between the highest and lowest Quarter is 1.16.

The TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars is highest at Quarter Q1 '19 and lowest at Quarter Q3 '17.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Quarter, and TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars in each Quarter on the y axis.

max_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Quarter, and TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars in each Quarter on the y axis.
Quarter Q1 '19 has the highest TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars and Q3 '17 has the lowest TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars.
The second highest TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars is appeared to be the Quarter Q3 '18.
The highest Quarter Q1 '19 has 1.16 more TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars than the lowest Quarter Q3 '17.
TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars at Quarter Q1 '19 is 27.59 , second place is Q3 '18 at 27.51, and thirdly is Q3 '18 at 27.51.
Overall TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars has reduced over the Quarters.
Quarter Q2 '19, and Q3 '18 have a similar TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars that is 27.51.
The Quarter Q3 '17 has 1.01 times less TTM gross billings per average active customer in U.S. dollars than average.
Summing up the values of all Quarters, we get total 272.46.
